Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the communications blackout in DC between 1am and 6am on June 1, 2020, as there is no evidence to support this statement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that there was a communications blackout in DC during the specified time period.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there was a communications blackout in DC without providing any substantial evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides alternative explanations and evidence that contradict the claim, suggesting that there was no communications blackout in DC during the specified time period.
